arts.ttl: Defensive woes and happy Tan - Wrexham v Cardiff talking points
arts.sum: BBC Sport Wales looks at the key talking points to emerge from Cardiff City's EFL Cup fourth round win over Wrexham at Stok Cae Ras.

arts.ttl: Will Fish fires Cardiff past old foes Wrexham and into Carabao Cup quarter-finals
arts.sum: Wrexham 1-2 Cardiff: The visitors emerged as deserved winners from a first meeting of the two Welsh clubs in more than two decades

arts.ttl: Will Fish chips in with vital goal for Cardiff after Wrexham fail to fire in derby
arts.athr: Will Unwin at STōK Cae Ras
arts.sum: After more than 21 years without facing one another, Cardiff had to wait a little longer to reacquaint themselves with their Welsh rivals, as Wrexham completely failed to turn up for the first half. The Bluebirds’ victory came as little of a shock, if anything their progress to the quarter‑finals should have been far easier. Yousef Salech put the League One side into a first-half lead but Cardiff missed numerous chances to finish off the match before it began in earnest. Wrexham joined the tie in the second half; substitute Kieffer Moore equalised but it was Will Fish who settled the match for the team from the capital. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Cardiff claim Welsh bragging rights by dumping Wrexham out of Carabao Cup
arts.sum: Cardiff put themselves in the hat for the Carabao Cup quarter-finals and grabbed the Welsh bragging rights with a 2-1 win over Wrexham.

arts.ttl: Fish lands the big catch as Cardiff claim bragging rights over Wrexham
arts.sum: Highlights of the fourth-round Carabao Cup match between Wrexham and Cardiff.

arts.ttl: Wrexham v Cardiff City: Carabao Cup – live
arts.sum: ⚽️ League Cup updates from the 8pm GMT kick-off ⚽️ Live scoreboard | Follow us on Bluesky | Mail Scott Will Unwin is our man at the Racecourse Ground tonight. He’s already set the scene thus … … and now he adds another splash of colour with this marvellous on-the-scene BREAKING FIASCO. An overzealous steward did not allow the man from the Football League carrying the Carabao Cup into the stadium because he did not have the correct accreditation. He did, however, have a massive trophy with him. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Wrexham vs Cardiff live: Welsh rivals collide for first time in 21 years in Carabao Cup tie
arts.sum: The two Welsh rivals vie for a quarter-final place

arts.ttl: Is Wrexham vs Cardiff City on TV? How to watch Carabao Cup action for FREE
arts.sum: Wrexham and Cardiff City will face off in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup on Tuesday night, with the all-Welsh clash set to be shown live on TV

arts.ttl: Gareth Bale's savage Wrexham transfer reply before true colours shown in £40m Cardiff bid
arts.sum: Gareth Bale has shown where his loyalties lie between Wrexham and Cardiff as the two sides prepare to face off in a Carabao Cup fourth round tie at the Racecourse Ground

arts.ttl: Wrexham’s Nathan Broadhead: ‘Cardiff fans I know are telling me not to score – hopefully I do’
arts.sum: Forward reflects on a changed landscape at north Wales club and looks forward to Tuesday’s big Carabao Cup clash “I want to get north Wales back up there and hopefully one day I can get them to the Premier League,” says Wrexham’s record signing, Nathan Broadhead. Back at the club after a 17-year absence, he did not miss a clash with Cardiff in that time but the rivals renew acquaintances in the Carabao Cup on Tuesday night, with the Red Dragons looking down on the boys from the Welsh capital. The enmity between Wrexham and Cardiff has cooled given they have not faced each other since a Welsh Cup semi-final in 2004 and last met in the league in March 2002 but a lively atmosphere can be expected at Stōk Cae Ras in the battle for a quarter-final spot. The two passed each other this summer, when Wrexham continued their journey up the leagues to the Championship, while the Bluebirds dropped into the third tier for the first time in 22 years. Continue reading...
